website_summaries.verdict: We love the keep-warm feature on this toaster that looks as good as it works.
pros: Toasts and then keeps your bread warm for up to 3 minutes after toasting
Handles 2 pieces of bread at once
The shape compliments the shape of your KitchenAid mixer
cons: Double check the size on this one

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a toaster & wanted something nice. I wasn’t expecting to pay so much but this toaster is really nice. Is it worth almost $300? Probably not, but I really like it & glad I got it. It looks amazing on my counter. I’m going to order the red one for my daughter
customer_reviews.author: Nazcarmom

customer_reviews.title: Pamper yourself
customer_reviews.text: What great toast. If you want a toaster that is top of the line this is it. I bought one as a gift because most people would not spend this kind of money on themselves, when a cheap toaster can be purchase for under $20. Until you have used this one, it's hard to understand the difference a high grade toaster makes. Pamper yourself for once.
customer_reviews.author: Baskin Toadvine

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, nice commands
customer_reviews.text: Pros : Beautiful, nice commands, nice mechanisms Cons : Not powerful enough (some times needs to put it twice) , The toast stays too low (difficult to get it when done)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long enough for price
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review because I bought this toaster to replace my Dualit toaster hoping it would be great... it is a very expensive toaster and did not last even 3 years... I would have hoped longer for the price. Nice looking but not good enough quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster ever used
customer_reviews.text: What a toaster! We are happily surprised by what it can do, making toast is so much fun now. The design is super cool too!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the high price!
customer_reviews.text: Oh so worth the high price. This is the best toaster I have ever owned and the auto down is my all time favorite feature.
customer_reviews.author: M  M.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered new, received used
customer_reviews.text: I love the toaster. However, I was extremely surprised and disappointed that a USED toaster was shipped but priced as new.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Miller

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid KMT2203OB Onyx Black 2-Slice Pro...
customer_reviews.text: The Ultimate toaster. Love, love, love it. I am so glad I got it. It is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best toaster I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled for some years to find a toaster that was high quality, wide slot for big bagels, consistent. This is it. The price is crazy high, but it is worth it if you use a toaster a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E. Levine MD

customer_reviews.title: Age??
customer_reviews.text: We love the toaster and have replaced it. We replaced it because it stopped toasting first on one side and then on the other. When replaced by Kitchen Aide, we found that the toaster was 12 YEARS OLD, but was purchased February 2018. I am not sure what the Kitchen Clique is doing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boone

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: I hated to spend the money on this toaster, but I like KitchenAid. It is worth every penny. I love this toaster. I love the automatic lift that lowers and raises the bagels. I love the countdown with the lights on the front of the toaster. I have it set on 4 for doneness and it is just perfect. Very good quality. I know what I'm getting my daughter's for Christmas this year. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The best part is it proves the "function follows form" analogy
customer_reviews.text: The absolute high end, luxury KitchenAid Pro Line appliance you showcase on your kitchen counter. The best part is it proves the "function follows form" analogy.
customer_reviews.author: Clay is Retired

customer_reviews.title: We love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: We love this toaster! You would think that toast is toast, but it's so much better when done in the KitchenAid Pro!
customer_reviews.author: Ducky 1

customer_reviews.title: Does it's high cost make it reliable?
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job on frozen bagels. They come out nicely toasted and slightly crunchy, regular white bread also toasts to perfection. That was the good part- now for the bad. On the fourth use, (owned for one week) regular white bread went through a toast cycle and stuck in the down position. No amount of pushes on the "cancel toast" button worked it was permanently jammed. The warranty dept. is sending a new exchange unit, so time will tell. My thoughts are that if Kitchenaid can warranty this unit for 5 years it should be reliable; we will see!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: After only one year of use this toaster only toast on one side. I'm disappointed. This toaster is way too expensive for only about a years use. Don't bother getting this one get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jjgmeg

customer_reviews.title: Toast too light at medium setting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toaster from Chefs Catalog but not though amazon checkout. I am concerned about it's performance when making toast. It has seven settings from Light (1) thru Dark (7). Using a fresh loaf of grocery store bakery white bread I got much too light results at '5' but acceptable results at '7' Dark. I took some images so you could see my results. The inside surface are those facing the center of the toaster while the outside surfaces are facing away. If your results are much different please post as I may have a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Slow, you're going to miss having your toast popup.
customer_reviews.text: Slow, you're going to miss having your toast popup. Doesn't get hot enough to crisp toast frozen waffles, but it will burn your toast. The bell gets annoying and you find yourself waiting for toast more often than not. Overall, I'd suggest opening a savings account and getting a free toaster over buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: TjP

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KMT2203OB Onyx Black 2-Slice Pro Line Toaster
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe KitchenAid Pro Line Series two-slice automatic toaster is equipped with a host of smart features for effortless toasting. The automatic Keep Warm function keeps toast warm for up to three minutes after toasting. Automatic lift and lower automatically lowers bread into the self-centering racks upon sensing bread in a slot, then lifts bread as soon as it has reached the selected shade. Seven shade settings allow you to choose precisely how light or dark you want your toast. Bagel and frozen functions make it easy to toast bagels or defrost. Backed by a manufacturers five year limited warranty, this professional two-slice toaster is sure to guarantee satisfaction.

13-7/10" L x 7-1/10" W x 8-9/10" H

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars123 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
